Inventory

  1. Once a GRN is made for a PO, the Material details and the quantity are reflected in the inventory. The material is received by default in default inward store.

Material Requisition

Material requisition is a Request to transfer material , issue material for production or for sale. They are classified as Material issue and Delivery notes.

  1. Material issue: Material requests for material movement within the organisation are referred to as Material issue. They are further classified as :
    1. Material Requisition (Transfers)
    2. Material Requisition (Processing)
  2. Delivery notes:Material requests for material movement outside the organisation are referred to as Delivery Notes. They are further classified as :
    1. Delivery Notes ( Sale):
      Delivery notes created to supply material to Customer against a sales order and invoiced to receive a payment against Supply.
    2. Delivery Notes ( Non-Billable)
      1. Delivery Notes ( Non-Billable, Returnable)
        Delivery notes created to supply material to Customer/ Sub-vendor not for the purpose of sale, with an expectation to receive the material back after the intended use.
      2. Delivery Notes ( Non-Billable, Non- Returnable)
        Delivery notes created to supply material to Customer/ Sub-vendor not for the purpose of sale, with no expectations to receive the material back. These could be accessories which are billed as part of the main order that are sent separately and hence not required to be billed.

Stores

  1. Inward store: Inward stores are the stores where raw material received from Suppliers is kept. Users can add multiple inward stores and select a store as default. Raw materials received will be placed in this store.
  2. Production stores : Production stores are the places where raw materials are processed. Users can add multiple Production units. They can choose a Production unit while issuing materials for production.In Production units Raw material is consumed and a processed finished goods are Produced in Production stores , which are then sent to appropriate inward stores.
  3. Stores (others): stores are the stores where finished goods are kept to be billed. Customers can add multiple stores.
  4. Sub Vendors: Raw Materials / Semi-processed goods are sent to a Sub-vendor for operations (processing or value addition) which are beyond the inhouse capabilities. Users can select Suppliers as a Sub-vendor store. They can choose a Sub-vendor while creating Delivery note to dispatch material. Material sent to Sub-Vendors might return to the stores or be billed to Customer directly from Sub vendor store. The appropriate option to be selected while creating a delivery note.Sub-vendor store need not be created and is generated automatically.
  5. Customers : Customers of users are part of this group by default. USers can Select a Customer while creating a delivery note to indicate sale or send materials to customer
